text: You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be aliveâ€”to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Waste no more time arguing what a good person should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Look well into thyself; there is a source of strength which will always spring up if thou wilt always look.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible for anyone to accomplish.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Nowhere can you find a quieter or more untroubled retreat than in your own soul.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the views which they take of things.
author: Epictetus

text: No person is free who is not master of themselves.
author: Epictetus

text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

text: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
author: Epictetus

text: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
author: Epictetus

text: It is difficulties that show what people are.
author: Epictetus

text: Freedom is the right to live as we wish; nothing else.
author: Epictetus

text: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
author: Epictetus

text: If a person gave your body to any stranger they met on their way, you would certainly be angry; and do you feel no shame in handing over your own mind to be puzzled and confounded by anyone who happens to verbally attack you?
author: Epictetus

text: It is impossible for a person to begin to learn what they think they already know.
author: Epictetus

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

text: It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste much of it.
author: Seneca

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

text: While we are postponing, life speeds by.
author: Seneca

text: Associate with those who will make you better.
author: Seneca

text: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
author: Seneca

text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

text: He who is brave is free.
author: Seneca

text: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
author: Seneca

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: He who conquers others is strong; he who conquers himself is mighty.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
author: Lao Tzu

text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Lao Tzu

text: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
author: Lao Tzu

text: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
author: Lao Tzu

text: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Respond intelligently even to unintelligent treatment.
author: Lao Tzu

text: All that we are is the result of what we have thought.
author: Buddha

text: Hatred is never appeased by hatred in this world; by non-hatred alone is hatred appeased.
author: Buddha

text: Better than a thousand hollow words is one word that brings peace.
author: Buddha

text: No one saves us but ourselves. We must walk the path.
author: Buddha

text: A disciplined mind brings happiness.
author: Buddha

text: The mind is difficult to control; a trained mind brings happiness.
author: Buddha

text: As a solid rock is not shaken by the wind, so the wise are not moved by praise or blame.
author: Buddha

text: Purity and impurity depend on oneself; no one can purify another.
author: Buddha

text: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own.
author: Buddha

text: If you light a lamp for someone else, it will also brighten your path.
author: Buddha

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

text: When we see people of worth, we should think of equaling them; when we see people of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
author: Confucius

text: The cautious seldom err.
author: Confucius

text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

text: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
author: Confucius

text: He who learns but does not think is lost; he who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.
author: Confucius

text: To see what is right and not do it is want of courage.
author: Confucius

text: The expectations of life depend upon diligence; the mechanic that would perfect their work must first sharpen their tools.
author: Confucius

text: You have a right to action, but not to the fruits of action.
author: Bhagavad Gita

text: For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is the best of friends; for one who has failed, the mind will be the greatest enemy.
author: Bhagavad Gita

text: Set thy heart upon thy work, but never on its reward.
author: Bhagavad Gita

text: Let your actions be pure, for your actions become your destiny.
author: Bhagavad Gita

text: When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
author: Bhagavad Gita

text: Perform your duty and abandon attachment to success and failure.
author: Bhagavad Gita

text: One becomes what one believes; as one's faith, so one is.
author: Bhagavad Gita

text: Better one's own duty, though imperfect, than another's duty well performed.
author: Bhagavad Gita

text: From attachment springs desire; from desire springs anger.
author: Bhagavad Gita

text: The self is a friend for one who has conquered the self; for one who has not, the self remains an enemy.
author: Bhagavad Gita

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: The bamboo that bends is stronger than the oak that resists.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: When the winds of change blow, some build walls, others build windmills.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Little by little, one travels far.
author: Tanzanian Proverb

text: The person who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: After the storm comes the calm.
author: Latin Proverb

text: The obstacle is the path.
author: Zen Proverb

text: He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: A reed before the wind lives on, while mighty oaks do fall.
author: French Proverb

text: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
author: attributed

text: Well begun is half done.
author: Aristotle

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies.
author: Aristotle

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: To err is human; to forgive, divine.
author: Alexander Pope

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Will Durant (summary of Aristotle)

text: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
author: Rumi

text: What you seek is seeking you.
author: Rumi

text: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
author: Rumi

text: Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love.
author: Rumi

text: The garden of love is green without limit and yields many fruits other than sorrow or joy.
author: Rumi

text: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
author: Seneca

text: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The things you think about determine the quality of your mind.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best of yourself?
author: Epictetus

text: To be even-minded is the greatest virtue.
author: Heraclitus
